instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,

Unit works while plugged in only. Showing 0%, battery just under 500 cycles.
Is there some common issue with those, or just dodgy battery? 

Thanks

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message: Post voltages for F7040 and 3V3_G3H on battery only.

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Thanks 2informaticos

F7040 6.99v on both ends
3V3_G3H is 3.3v - checked in 3 different points

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Now connect charger (plus battery) and post voltages for Q7055.
Looks like you have bad battery...

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Q7055 is blocked by U7000, so no charge possible.
I recommend you to test known good battery.
Any history available?

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Dent in the bottom left corner on the screen tells me that it was dropped.
No history otherwise
Ok, I will source a new battery and see how it goes

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
New battery in, still not charging

Q7055

1  8.3
2  8.3
3  8.3
4  0
5  8.3

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Really strange, Q7055 is enabled now, and PPBUS_G3H looks like charging.
OSX reports battery percentage at least?
Does it start on battery only?
Be sure SYS_DETECT is high and SYS_DETECT_L is low.
Try pressing SW6900 few seconds...

threads.title: 12" Macbook 820-00244-A not charging
threads.message:
Thank you 2informaticos.
I tried it again and all is working, looks like it was the battery

I am very grateful for all your help
